001package squidpony.squidgrid;
002
003import squidpony.ArrayTools;
004import squidpony.squidgrid.mapping.DungeonUtility;
005import squidpony.squidmath.*;
006
007import java.io.Serializable;
008import java.util.*;
009
010/**
011 * This class provides methods for calculating Field of View in grids. Field of
012 * View (FOV) algorithms determine how much area surrounding a point can be
013 * seen. They return a 2D array of doubles, representing the amount of view
014 * (typically sight, but perhaps sound, smell, etc.) which the origin has of
015 * each cell. In the returned 2D array, 1.0 is always "fully seen," while 0.0
016 * is always "unseen." Values in between are much more common, and they enable
017 * this class to be used for lighting effects.
018 * <br>
019 * The input resistanceMap is considered the percent of opacity. This resistance
020 * is on top of the resistance applied from the light spreading out. You can
021 * obtain a resistance map easily with the {@link #generateResistances(char[][])}
022 * method, which uses defaults for common chars used in SquidLib, but you may
023 * also want to create a resistance map manually if a given char means something
024 * very different in your game. This is easy enough to do by looping over all the
025 * x,y positions in your char[][] map and running a switch statement on each char,
026 * assigning a double to the same x,y position in a double[][]. The value should
027 * be between 0.0 (unblocked) for things light passes through, 1.0 (blocked) for
028 * things light can't pass at all, and possibly other values if you have
029 * translucent obstacles. There's {@link #generateSimpleResistances(char[][])} as
030 * well, which only returns 1.0 (fully blocked) or 0.0 (passable), and 3x3 subcell
031 * variants, which produce a resistance map that is 3 times wider and 3 times
032 * taller than the input map. The subcell variants have especially useful behavior
033 * when using {@link DungeonUtility#hashesToLines(char[][])} to draw a map with
034 * box-drawing characters, since these 3x3 resistance maps will line up blocking
035 * cells to where a box-drawing line is.
036 * <br>
037 * The returned light map is considered the percent of light in the cells.
038 * <br>
039 * All implementations for FOV here (that is, Ripple FOV and Shadow FOV) provide
040 * percentage levels for partially-lit or partially-seen cells. This leads to a
041 * straightforward implementation of soft lighting using an FOV result -- just
042 * mix the background or floor color of a cell, however you represent it, with
043 * a very light color (like pastel yellow), with the percentage of the light
044 * color to mix in equal to the percent of light in the FOV map.
045 * <br>
046 * All solvers perform bounds checking so solid borders in the map are not
047 * required.
048 * <br>
049 * For calculating FOV maps, this class provides both instance methods, which
050 * attempt to reuse the same 2D array for light stored in the object, and static
051 * methods, which take a light 2D array as an argument and edit it in-place.
052 * In older versions of SquidLib, constantly allocating and returning 2D double
053 * arrays on each call dragged performance down, but both of the new methods
054 * should perform well.
055 * <br>
056 * Static methods are provided to add together FOV maps in the simple way
057 * (disregarding visibility of distant FOV from a given cell), or the more
058 * practical way for roguelikes (where a cell needs to be within line-of-sight
059 * in the first place for a distant light to illuminate it). The second method
060 * relies on an LOS map, which is essentially the same as a very-high-radius
061 * FOV map and can be easily obtained with calculateLOSMap().
062 * <br>
063 * If you want to iterate through cells that are visible in a double[][] returned
064 * by FOV, you can pass that double[][] to the constructor for GreasedRegion, and
065 * you can use the GreasedRegion as a reliably-ordered Collection of Coord (among
066 * other things). The order GreasedRegion iterates in is somewhat strange, and
067 * doesn't, for example, start at the center of an FOV map, but it will be the
068 * same every time you create a GreasedRegion with the same FOV map (or the same
069 * visible Coords).
070 * <br>
071 * This class is not thread-safe. This is generally true for most of SquidLib.
072 *
073 * @author Eben Howard - http://squidpony.com - howard@squidpony.com
074 */
075public class FOV implements Serializable {
076    private static final long serialVersionUID = 3258723684733275798L;
077    /**
078     * Performs FOV by pushing values outwards from the source location.
079     * It will go around corners a bit. This corresponds to a
080     * {@code rippleLooseness} of 2 in {@link #reuseRippleFOV(double[][], double[][], int, int, int, double, Radius)}.
081     */
082    public static final int RIPPLE = 1;
083    /**
084     * Performs FOV by pushing values outwards from the source location.
085     * It will spread around edges like smoke or water, but maintain a
086     * tendency to curl towards the start position when going around
087     * edges. This corresponds to a {@code rippleLooseness} of 3
088     * in {@link #reuseRippleFOV(double[][], double[][], int, int, int, double, Radius)}.
089     */
090    public static final int RIPPLE_LOOSE = 2;
091    /**
092     * Performs FOV by pushing values outwards from the source location.
093     * It will only go around corners slightly. This corresponds to a
094     * {@code rippleLooseness} of 1 in {@link #reuseRippleFOV(double[][], double[][], int, int, int, double, Radius)}.
095     */
096    public static final int RIPPLE_TIGHT = 3;
097    /**
098     * Performs FOV by pushing values outwards from the source location.
099     * It will go around corners massively. This corresponds to a
100     * {@code rippleLooseness} of 6 in {@link #reuseRippleFOV(double[][], double[][], int, int, int, double, Radius)}.
101     */
102    public static final int RIPPLE_VERY_LOOSE = 4;
103    /**
104     * Uses Shadow Casting FOV algorithm. Returns a percentage from 1.0 (center of
105     * FOV) to 0.0 (outside of FOV).
106     */
107    public static final int SHADOW = 5;
108    private int type = SHADOW;
109
110        /**
111         * Data allocated in the previous calls to the public API, if any. Used to
112         * save allocations when multiple calls are done on the same instance.
113         */
114    protected double[][] light;
115        /**
116         * Data allocated in the previous calls to the public API, if any. Used to
117         * save allocations when multiple calls are done on the same instance.
118         */
119    protected GreasedRegion nearLight;
120
121    protected static final Direction[] ccw = new Direction[]
122            {Direction.UP_RIGHT, Direction.UP_LEFT, Direction.DOWN_LEFT, Direction.DOWN_RIGHT, Direction.UP_RIGHT},
123            ccw_full = new Direction[]{Direction.RIGHT, Direction.UP_RIGHT, Direction.UP, Direction.UP_LEFT,
124            Direction.LEFT, Direction.DOWN_LEFT, Direction.DOWN, Direction.DOWN_RIGHT};
125    private static final ArrayDeque<Coord> dq = new ArrayDeque<>();
126    private static final GreasedRegion lightWorkspace = new GreasedRegion(64, 64);
127
128    /**
129     * Creates a solver which will use the default SHADOW solver.
130     */
131    public FOV() {
132    }
133
134    /**
135     * Creates a solver which will use the provided FOV solver type, typically one of {@link #SHADOW} (the default),
136     * {@link #RIPPLE}, {@link #RIPPLE_TIGHT}, {@link #RIPPLE_LOOSE}, or {@link #RIPPLE_VERY_LOOSE}.
137     * @param type
138     */
139    public FOV(int type) {
140        this.type = type;
141    }
142
143    /**
144     * Calculates the Field Of View for the provided map from the given x, y
145     * coordinates. Returns a light map where the values represent a percentage
146     * of fully lit.
147     *
148     * The starting point for the calculation is considered to be at the center
149     * of the origin cell. Radius determinations based on Euclidean
150     * calculations. The light will be treated as having infinite possible
151     * radius.
152     *
153     * @param resistanceMap the grid of cells to calculate on; the kind made by {@link #generateResistances(char[][])}
154     * @param startx the horizontal component of the starting location
155     * @param starty the vertical component of the starting location
156     * @return the computed light grid
157     */
158    public double[][] calculateFOV(double[][] resistanceMap, int startx, int starty) {
159        return calculateFOV(resistanceMap, startx, starty, Integer.MAX_VALUE);
160    }
161
162    /**
163     * Calculates the Field Of View for the provided map from the given x, y
164     * coordinates. Returns a light map where the values represent a percentage
165     * of fully lit.
166     *
167     * The starting point for the calculation is considered to be at the center
168     * of the origin cell. Radius determinations based on Euclidean
169     * calculations.
170     *
171     * @param resistanceMap the grid of cells to calculate on; the kind made by {@link #generateResistances(char[][])}
172     * @param startx the horizontal component of the starting location
173     * @param starty the vertical component of the starting location
174     * @param radius the distance the light will extend to
175     * @return the computed light grid
176     */
177    public double[][] calculateFOV(double[][] resistanceMap, int startx, int starty, double radius) {
178        return calculateFOV(resistanceMap, startx, starty, radius, Radius.CIRCLE);
179    }
180
181    /**
182     * Calculates the Field Of View for the provided map from the given x, y
183     * coordinates. Returns a light map where the values represent a percentage
184     * of fully lit.
185     *
186     * The starting point for the calculation is considered to be at the center
187     * of the origin cell. Radius determinations are determined by the provided
188     * RadiusStrategy.
189     *
190     * @param resistanceMap the grid of cells to calculate on; the kind made by {@link #generateResistances(char[][])}
191     * @param startX the horizontal component of the starting location
192     * @param startY the vertical component of the starting location
193     * @param radius the distance the light will extend to
194     * @param radiusTechnique provides a means to calculate the radius as desired
195     * @return the computed light grid
196     */
197    public double[][] calculateFOV(double[][] resistanceMap, int startX, int startY, double radius, Radius radiusTechnique) {
198        double decay = 1.0 / radius;
199
200        int width = resistanceMap.length;
201        int height = resistanceMap[0].length;
202
203        initializeLightMap(width, height);
204        light[startX][startY] = Math.min(1.0, radius);//make the starting space full power unless radius is tiny
205
206        switch (type) {
207            case RIPPLE:
208            case RIPPLE_LOOSE:
209            case RIPPLE_TIGHT:
210            case RIPPLE_VERY_LOOSE:
211                initializeNearLight(width, height);
212                doRippleFOV(light, rippleValue(type), startX, startY, decay, radius, resistanceMap, nearLight, radiusTechnique);
213                break;
214            default:
215                for (Direction d : Direction.DIAGONALS) {
216                    shadowCast(0, d.deltaX, d.deltaY, 0, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique);
217                    shadowCast(d.deltaX, 0, 0, d.deltaY, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique);
218                }
219                break;
220        }
221        return light;
222    }
223
224        /**
225     * Calculates the Field Of View for the provided map from the given x, y
226     * coordinates. Returns a light map where the values represent a percentage
227     * of fully lit.
228     *
229     * The starting point for the calculation is considered to be at the center
230     * of the origin cell. Radius determinations are determined by the provided
231     * RadiusStrategy. A conical section of FOV is lit by this method if
232     * span is greater than 0.
233     *
234     * @param resistanceMap the grid of cells to calculate on; the kind made by {@link #generateResistances(char[][])}
235     * @param startX the horizontal component of the starting location
236     * @param startY the vertical component of the starting location
237     * @param radius the distance the light will extend to
238     * @param radiusTechnique provides a means to calculate the radius as desired
239     * @param angle the angle in degrees that will be the center of the FOV cone, 0 points right
240     * @param span the angle in degrees that measures the full arc contained in the FOV cone
241     * @return the computed light grid
242     */
243    public double[][] calculateFOV(double[][] resistanceMap, int startX, int startY, double radius,
244                                   Radius radiusTechnique, double angle, double span) {
245        double decay = 1.0 / radius;
246        angle = ((angle >= 360.0 || angle < 0.0)
247                ? MathExtras.remainder(angle, 360.0) : angle) * 0.002777777777777778;
248        span = span * 0.002777777777777778;
249        int width = resistanceMap.length;
250        int height = resistanceMap[0].length;
251
252        initializeLightMap(width, height);
253        light[startX][startY] = Math.min(1.0, radius);//make the starting space full power unless radius is tiny
254
255        switch (type) {
256            case RIPPLE:
257            case RIPPLE_LOOSE:
258            case RIPPLE_TIGHT:
259            case RIPPLE_VERY_LOOSE:
260                initializeNearLight(width, height);
261                doRippleFOV(light, rippleValue(type), startX, startY, decay, radius, resistanceMap, nearLight, radiusTechnique, angle, span);
262                break;
263            default:
264                light = shadowCastLimited(1, 1.0, 0.0, 0, 1, 1, 0, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique, angle, span);
265                light = shadowCastLimited(1, 1.0, 0.0, 1, 0, 0, 1, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique, angle, span);
266
267                light = shadowCastLimited(1, 1.0, 0.0, 0, -1, 1, 0, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique, angle, span);
268                light = shadowCastLimited(1, 1.0, 0.0, -1, 0, 0, 1, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique, angle, span);
269
270                light = shadowCastLimited(1, 1.0, 0.0, 0, -1, -1, 0, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique, angle, span);
271                light = shadowCastLimited(1, 1.0, 0.0, -1, 0, 0, -1, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique, angle, span);
272
273                light = shadowCastLimited(1, 1.0, 0.0, 0, 1, -1, 0, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique, angle, span);
274                light = shadowCastLimited(1, 1.0, 0.0, 1, 0, 0, -1, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique, angle, span);
275                break;
276        }
277
278        return light;
279    }
280
281
282    /**
283     * Calculates the Field Of View for the provided map from the given x, y
284     * coordinates. Assigns to, and returns, a light map where the values
285     * represent a percentage of fully lit. Always uses shadowcasting FOV,
286     * which allows this method to be static since it doesn't need to keep any
287     * state around, and can reuse the state the user gives it via the
288     * {@code light} parameter.  The values in light are always cleared before
289     * this is run, because prior state can make this give incorrect results.
290     * <br>
291     * The starting point for the calculation is considered to be at the center
292     * of the origin cell. Radius determinations based on Euclidean
293     * calculations. The light will be treated as having infinite possible
294     * radius.
295     * <br>
296     * This static method is equivalent to the static method {@link #reuseFOV(double[][], double[][], int, int)},
297     * but all of the overloads are called reuseFOV(), so this method name is discouraged for new code. Both delegate to
298     * {@link #reuseFOV(double[][], double[][], int, int, double, Radius)} anyway.
299     * 
300     * @param resistanceMap the grid of cells to calculate on; the kind made by {@link #generateResistances(char[][])}
301     * @param light a non-null 2D double array that will have its contents overwritten, modified, and returned
302     * @param startx the horizontal component of the starting location
303     * @param starty the vertical component of the starting location
304     * @return the computed light grid (the same as {@code light})
305     */
306    public static double[][] calculateFOV(double[][] resistanceMap, double[][] light, int startx, int starty) {
307        return reuseFOV(resistanceMap, light, startx, starty, Integer.MAX_VALUE, Radius.CIRCLE);
308    }
309
310    /**
311     * Calculates the Field Of View for the provided map from the given x, y
312     * coordinates. Assigns to, and returns, a light map where the values
313     * represent a percentage of fully lit. Always uses shadowcasting FOV,
314     * which allows this method to be static since it doesn't need to keep any
315     * state around, and can reuse the state the user gives it via the
316     * {@code light} parameter.  The values in light are always cleared before
317     * this is run, because prior state can make this give incorrect results.
318     * <br>
319     * The starting point for the calculation is considered to be at the center
320     * of the origin cell. Radius determinations based on Euclidean
321     * calculations. The light will be treated as having infinite possible
322     * radius.
323     * <br>
324     * This static method is equivalent to the static method {@link #calculateFOV(double[][], double[][], int, int)},
325     * but all of the overloads are called reuseFOV(), so this method name is preferred in new code. Both delegate to
326     * {@link #reuseFOV(double[][], double[][], int, int, double, Radius)} anyway.
327     *
328     * @param resistanceMap the grid of cells to calculate on; the kind made by {@link #generateResistances(char[][])}
329     * @param light a non-null 2D double array that will have its contents overwritten, modified, and returned
330     * @param startx the horizontal component of the starting location
331     * @param starty the vertical component of the starting location
332     * @return the computed light grid (the same as {@code light})
333     */
334    public static double[][] reuseFOV(double[][] resistanceMap, double[][] light, int startx, int starty) {
335        return reuseFOV(resistanceMap, light, startx, starty, Integer.MAX_VALUE, Radius.CIRCLE);
336    }
337
338    /**
339     * Calculates the Field Of View for the provided map from the given x, y
340     * coordinates. Assigns to, and returns, a light map where the values
341     * represent a percentage of fully lit. Always uses shadowcasting FOV,
342     * which allows this method to be static since it doesn't need to keep any
343     * state around, and can reuse the state the user gives it via the
344     * {@code light} parameter. The values in light are always cleared before
345     * this is run, because prior state can make this give incorrect results.
346     * <br>
347     * The starting point for the calculation is considered to be at the center
348     * of the origin cell. Radius determinations based on Euclidean
349     * calculations.
350     *
351     * @param resistanceMap the grid of cells to calculate on; the kind made by {@link #generateResistances(char[][])}
352     * @param startx the horizontal component of the starting location
353     * @param starty the vertical component of the starting location
354     * @param radius the distance the light will extend to
355     * @return the computed light grid
356     */
357    public static double[][] reuseFOV(double[][] resistanceMap, double[][] light, int startx, int starty, double radius) {
358        return reuseFOV(resistanceMap, light, startx, starty, radius, Radius.CIRCLE);
359    }
360
361
362    /**
363     * Calculates the Field Of View for the provided map from the given x, y
364     * coordinates. Assigns to, and returns, a light map where the values
365     * represent a percentage of fully lit. Always uses shadowcasting FOV,
366     * which allows this method to be static since it doesn't need to keep any
367     * state around, and can reuse the state the user gives it via the
368     * {@code light} parameter. The values in light are always cleared before
369     * this is run, because prior state can make this give incorrect results.
370     * <br>
371     * The starting point for the calculation is considered to be at the center
372     * of the origin cell. Radius determinations are determined by the provided
373     * RadiusStrategy.
374     * @param resistanceMap the grid of cells to calculate on; the kind made by {@link #generateResistances(char[][])}
375     * @param light the grid of cells to assign to; may have existing values, and 0.0 is used to mean "unlit"
376     * @param startX the horizontal component of the starting location
377     * @param startY the vertical component of the starting location
378     * @param radius the distance the light will extend to
379     * @param radiusTechnique provides a means to calculate the radius as desired
380     * @return the computed light grid, which is the same 2D array as the value assigned to {@code light}
381     */
382    public static double[][] reuseFOV(double[][] resistanceMap, double[][] light, int startX, int startY, double radius, Radius radiusTechnique)
383    {
384        double decay = 1.0 / radius;
385        ArrayTools.fill(light, 0);
386        light[startX][startY] = Math.min(1.0, radius);//make the starting space full power unless radius is tiny
387
388
389        shadowCast(0, 1, 1, 0, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique);
390        shadowCast(1, 0, 0, 1, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique);
391
392        shadowCast(0, 1, -1, 0, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique);
393        shadowCast(1, 0, 0, -1, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique);
394
395        shadowCast(0, -1, -1, 0, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique);
396        shadowCast(-1, 0, 0, -1, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique);
397
398        shadowCast(0, -1, 1, 0, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique);
399        shadowCast(-1, 0, 0, 1, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique);
400        return light;
401    }
402    /**
403     * Calculates the Field Of View for the provided map from the given x, y
404     * coordinates. Assigns to, and returns, a light map where the values
405     * represent a percentage of fully lit. Always uses shadowcasting FOV,
406     * which allows this method to be static since it doesn't need to keep any
407     * state around, and can reuse the state the user gives it via the
408     * {@code light} parameter. The values in light are always cleared before
409     * this is run, because prior state can make this give incorrect results.
410     * <br>
411     * The starting point for the calculation is considered to be at the center
412     * of the origin cell. Radius determinations are determined by the provided
413     * RadiusStrategy.
414     * @param resistanceMap the grid of cells to calculate on; the kind made by {@link #generateResistances(char[][])}
415     * @param light the grid of cells to assign to; may have existing values, and 0.0 is used to mean "unlit"
416     * @param startX the horizontal component of the starting location
417     * @param startY the vertical component of the starting location
418     * @param radius the distance the light will extend to
419     * @param radiusTechnique provides a means to calculate the radius as desired
420     * @return the computed light grid, which is the same 2D array as the value assigned to {@code light}
421     */
422    public static double[][] reuseFOVSymmetrical(double[][] resistanceMap, double[][] light, int startX, int startY, double radius, Radius radiusTechnique)
423    {
424        double decay = 1.0 / radius;
425        ArrayTools.fill(light, 0);
426        light[startX][startY] = Math.min(1.0, radius);//make the starting space full power unless radius is tiny
427
428
429        shadowCast(0, 1, 1, 0, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique);
430        for (int row = 0; row <= radius + 1.0; row++) {
431            for (int col = Math.max(1,row); col <= radius + 1.0; col++) {
432                if(startX - col >= 0 && startY - row >= 0 && resistanceMap[startX - col][startY - row] < 1.0 &&
433                        !shadowCastCheck(1, 1.0, 0.0, 0, -1, -1, 0, radius, startX - col, startY - row, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique, 0, 0, light.length, light[0].length, startX, startY))
434                    light[startX - col][startY - row] = 0.0;
435            }
436        }
437        shadowCast(1, 0, 0, 1, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique);
438        for (int col = 0; col <= radius + 1.0; col++) {
439            for (int row = Math.max(1,col); row <= radius + 1.0; row++) {
440                if(startX - col >= 0 && startY - row >= 0 && resistanceMap[startX - col][startY - row] < 1.0 &&
441                        !shadowCastCheck(1, 1.0, 0.0, -1, 0, 0, -1, radius, startX - col, startY - row, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique, 0, 0, light.length, light[0].length, startX, startY))
442                    light[startX - col][startY - row] = 0.0;
443            }
444        }
445
446        shadowCast(0, 1, -1, 0, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique);
447        for (int row = 0; row <= radius + 1.0; row++) {
448            for (int col = Math.max(1,row); col <= radius + 1.0; col++) {
449                if(startX - col >= 0 && startY + row < light[0].length &&  resistanceMap[startX - col][startY + row] < 1.0 &&
450                        !shadowCastCheck(1, 1.0, 0.0, 0, -1, 1, 0, radius, startX - col, startY + row, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique, 0, 0, light.length, light[0].length, startX, startY))
451                    light[startX - col][startY + row] = 0.0;
452            }
453        }
454        shadowCast(1, 0, 0, -1, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique);
455        for (int col = 0; col <= radius + 1.0; col++) {
456            for (int row = Math.max(1,col); row <= radius + 1.0; row++) {
457                if(startX - col >= 0 && startY + row < light[0].length && resistanceMap[startX - col][startY + row] < 1.0 &&
458                        !shadowCastCheck(1, 1.0, 0.0, -1, 0, 0, 1, radius, startX - col, startY + row, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique, 0, 0, light.length, light[0].length, startX, startY))
459                    light[startX - col][startY + row] = 0.0;
460            }
461        }
462
463        shadowCast(0, -1, -1, 0, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique);
464        for (int row = 0; row <= radius + 1.0; row++) {
465            for (int col = Math.max(1,row); col <= radius + 1.0; col++) {
466                if(startX + col < light.length && startY + row < light[0].length && resistanceMap[startX + col][startY + row] < 1.0 &&
467                        !shadowCastCheck(1, 1.0, 0.0, 0, 1, 1, 0, radius, startX + col, startY + row, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique, 0, 0, light.length, light[0].length, startX, startY))
468                    light[startX + col][startY + row] = 0.0;
469            }
470        }
471        shadowCast(-1, 0, 0, -1, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique);
472        for (int col = 0; col <= radius + 1.0; col++) {
473            for (int row = Math.max(1,col); row <= radius + 1.0; row++) {
474                if(startX + col < light.length && startY + row < light[0].length && resistanceMap[startX + col][startY + row] < 1.0 &&
475                        !shadowCastCheck(1, 1.0, 0.0, 1, 0, 0, 1, radius, startX + col, startY + row, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique, 0, 0, light.length, light[0].length, startX, startY))
476                    light[startX + col][startY + row] = 0.0;
477            }
478        }
479
480        shadowCast(0, -1, 1, 0, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique);
481        for (int row = 0; row <= radius + 1.0 && startY + row < light[0].length; row++) {
482            for (int col = Math.max(1,row); col <= radius + 1.0; col++) {
483                if(startX + col < light.length && startY - row >= 0 && resistanceMap[startX + col][startY - row] < 1.0 &&
484                        !shadowCastCheck(1, 1.0, 0.0, 0, 1, -1, 0, radius, startX + col, startY - row, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique, 0, 0, light.length, light[0].length, startX, startY))
485                    light[startX + col][startY - row] = 0.0;
486            }
487        }
488        shadowCast(-1, 0, 0, 1, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique);
489        for (int col = 0; col <= radius + 1.0; col++) {
490            for (int row = Math.max(1,col); row <= radius + 1.0; row++) {
491                if(startX + col < light.length && startY - row >= 0 && resistanceMap[startX + col][startY - row] < 1.0 &&
492                        !shadowCastCheck(1, 1.0, 0.0, 1, 0, 0, -1, radius, startX + col, startY - row, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique, 0, 0, light.length, light[0].length, startX, startY))
493                    light[startX + col][startY - row] = 0.0;
494            }
495        }
496        return light;
497    }
498    /**
499     * Calculates which cells have line of sight from the given x, y coordinates.
500     * Assigns to, and returns, a light map where the values
501     * are always either 0.0 for "not in line of sight" or 1.0 for "in line of
502     * sight," which doesn't mean a cell is actually visible if there's no light
503     * in that cell. Always uses shadowcasting FOV, which allows this method to
504     * be static since it doesn't need to keep any state around, and can reuse the
505     * state the user gives it via the {@code light} parameter. The values in light
506     * are always cleared before this is run, because prior state can make this give
507     * incorrect results.
508     * <br>
509     * The starting point for the calculation is considered to be at the center
510     * of the origin cell. Radius determinations are pretty much irrelevant because
511     * the distance doesn't matter, only the presence of a clear line, but this uses
512     * {@link Radius#SQUARE} if it matters.
513     * @param resistanceMap the grid of cells to calculate on; the kind made by {@link #generateResistances(char[][])}
514     * @param light the grid of cells to assign to; may have existing values, and 0.0 is used to mean "no line"
515     * @param startX the horizontal component of the starting location
516     * @param startY the vertical component of the starting location
517     * @return the computed light grid, which is the same 2D array as the value assigned to {@code light}
518     */
519    public static double[][] reuseLOS(double[][] resistanceMap, double[][] light, int startX, int startY)
520    {
521        return reuseLOS(resistanceMap, light, startX, startY, 0, 0, light.length, light[0].length);
522    }
523    /**
524     * Calculates which cells have line of sight from the given x, y coordinates.
525     * Assigns to, and returns, a light map where the values
526     * are always either 0.0 for "not in line of sight" or 1.0 for "in line of
527     * sight," which doesn't mean a cell is actually visible if there's no light
528     * in that cell. Always uses shadowcasting FOV, which allows this method to
529     * be static since it doesn't need to keep any state around, and can reuse the
530     * state the user gives it via the {@code light} parameter. The values in light
531     * are always cleared before this is run, because prior state can make this give
532     * incorrect results.
533     * <br>
534     * The starting point for the calculation is considered to be at the center
535     * of the origin cell. Radius determinations are pretty much irrelevant because
536     * the distance doesn't matter, only the presence of a clear line, but this uses
537     * {@link Radius#SQUARE} if it matters.
538     * @param resistanceMap the grid of cells to calculate on; the kind made by {@link #generateResistances(char[][])}
539     * @param light the grid of cells to assign to; may have existing values, and 0.0 is used to mean "no line"
540     * @param startX the horizontal component of the starting location
541     * @param startY the vertical component of the starting location
542     * @return the computed light grid, which is the same 2D array as the value assigned to {@code light}
543     */
544    public static double[][] reuseLOS(double[][] resistanceMap, double[][] light, int startX, int startY,
545                                      int minX, int minY, int maxX, int maxY)
546    {
547        double radius = light.length + light[0].length;
548        double decay = 1.0 / radius;
549        ArrayTools.fill(light, 0);
550        light[startX][startY] = 1;//make the starting space full power
551        
552        shadowCastBinary(1, 1.0, 0.0, 0, 1, 1, 0, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, Radius.SQUARE, minX, minY, maxX, maxY);
553        shadowCastBinary(1, 1.0, 0.0, 1, 0, 0, 1, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, Radius.SQUARE, minX, minY, maxX, maxY);
554        shadowCastBinary(1, 1.0, 0.0, 0, 1, -1, 0, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, Radius.SQUARE, minX, minY, maxX, maxY);
555        shadowCastBinary(1, 1.0, 0.0, 1, 0, 0, -1, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, Radius.SQUARE, minX, minY, maxX, maxY);
556        shadowCastBinary(1, 1.0, 0.0, 0, -1, -1, 0, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, Radius.SQUARE, minX, minY, maxX, maxY);
557        shadowCastBinary(1, 1.0, 0.0, -1, 0, 0, -1, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, Radius.SQUARE, minX, minY, maxX, maxY);
558        shadowCastBinary(1, 1.0, 0.0, 0, -1, 1, 0, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, Radius.SQUARE, minX, minY, maxX, maxY);
559        shadowCastBinary(1, 1.0, 0.0, -1, 0, 0, 1, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, Radius.SQUARE, minX, minY, maxX, maxY);
560        
561        return light;
562    }
563    /**
564     * Calculates the Field Of View for the provided map from the given x, y
565     * coordinates, lighting at the given angle in  degrees and covering a span
566     * centered on that angle, also in degrees. Assigns to, and returns, a light
567     * map where the values represent a percentage of fully lit. Always uses
568     * shadowcasting FOV, which allows this method to be static since it doesn't
569     * need to keep any state around, and can reuse the state the user gives it
570     * via the {@code light} parameter. The values in light are cleared before
571     * this is run, because prior state can make this give incorrect results.
572     * <br>
573     * The starting point for the calculation is considered to be at the center
574     * of the origin cell. Radius determinations are determined by the provided
575     * RadiusStrategy.  A conical section of FOV is lit by this method if
576     * span is greater than 0.
577     *
578     * @param resistanceMap the grid of cells to calculate on; the kind made by {@link #generateResistances(char[][])}
579     * @param light the grid of cells to assign to; may have existing values, and 0.0 is used to mean "unlit"
580     * @param startX the horizontal component of the starting location
581     * @param startY the vertical component of the starting location
582     * @param radius the distance the light will extend to
583     * @param radiusTechnique provides a means to shape the FOV by changing distance calculation (circle, square, etc.)
584     * @param angle the angle in degrees that will be the center of the FOV cone, 0 points right
585     * @param span the angle in degrees that measures the full arc contained in the FOV cone
586     * @return the computed light grid
587     */
588    public static double[][] reuseFOV(double[][] resistanceMap, double[][] light, int startX, int startY,
589                                          double radius, Radius radiusTechnique, double angle, double span) {
590        double decay = 1.0 / radius;
591        ArrayTools.fill(light, 0);
592        light[startX][startY] = Math.min(1.0, radius);//make the starting space full power unless radius is tiny
593        angle = ((angle >= 360.0 || angle < 0.0)
594                ? MathExtras.remainder(angle, 360.0) : angle) * 0.002777777777777778;
595        span = span * 0.002777777777777778;
596
597
598        light = shadowCastLimited(1, 1.0, 0.0, 0, 1, 1, 0, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique, angle, span);
599        light = shadowCastLimited(1, 1.0, 0.0, 1, 0, 0, 1, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique, angle, span);
600
601        light = shadowCastLimited(1, 1.0, 0.0, 0, -1, 1, 0, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique, angle, span);
602        light = shadowCastLimited(1, 1.0, 0.0, -1, 0, 0, 1, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique, angle, span);
603
604        light = shadowCastLimited(1, 1.0, 0.0, 0, -1, -1, 0, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique, angle, span);
605        light = shadowCastLimited(1, 1.0, 0.0, -1, 0, 0, -1, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique, angle, span);
606
607        light = shadowCastLimited(1, 1.0, 0.0, 0, 1, -1, 0, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique, angle, span);
608        light = shadowCastLimited(1, 1.0, 0.0, 1, 0, 0, -1, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique, angle, span);
609        return light;
610    }
611
612    /**
613     * Like the {@link #reuseFOV(double[][], double[][], int, int, double, Radius)} method, but this uses Ripple FOV
614     * with a configurable tightness/looseness (between 1, tightest, and 6, loosest). Other parameters are similar; you
615     * can get a resistance map from {@link #generateResistances(char[][])}, {@code light} will be modified and returned
616     * (it will be overwritten, but its size should be the same as the resistance map), there's a starting x,y position,
617     * a radius in cells, and a {@link Radius} enum constant to choose the distance measurement.
618     * @param resistanceMap probably calculated with {@link #generateResistances(char[][])}; 1.0 blocks light, 0.0 allows it
619     * @param light will be overwritten! Should be initialized with the same size as {@code resistanceMap}
620     * @param rippleLooseness affects spread; between 1 and 6, inclusive; 1 is tightest, 2 is normal, and 6 is loosest
621     * @param x starting x position to look from
622     * @param y starting y position to look from
623     * @param radius the distance to extend from the starting x,y position
624     * @param radiusTechnique how to measure distance; typically {@link Radius#CIRCLE}.
625     * @return {@code light}, after writing the FOV map into it; 1.0 is fully lit and 0.0 is unseen
626     */
627    public static double[][] reuseRippleFOV(double[][] resistanceMap, double[][] light, int rippleLooseness, int x, int y, double radius, Radius radiusTechnique) {
628        ArrayTools.fill(light, 0);
629        light[x][y] = Math.min(1.0, radius);//make the starting space full power unless radius is tiny
630        lightWorkspace.resizeAndEmpty(light.length, light[0].length);
631        doRippleFOV(light, MathExtras.clamp(rippleLooseness, 1, 6), x, y, 1.0 / radius, radius, resistanceMap, lightWorkspace, radiusTechnique);
632        return light;
633    }
634
635    /**
636     * Like the {@link #reuseFOV(double[][], double[][], int, int, double, Radius, double, double)} method, but this
637     * uses Ripple FOV with a configurable tightness/looseness (between 1, tightest, and 6, loosest). Other parameters
638     * are similar; you can get a resistance map from {@link #generateResistances(char[][])}, {@code light} will be
639     * modified and returned (it will be overwritten, but its size should be the same as the resistance map), there's 
640     * starting x,y position, a radius in cells, a {@link Radius} enum constant to choose the distance measurement, and
641     * the angle/span combination to specify a conical section of FOV (span is the total in degrees, centered on angle).
642     * @param resistanceMap probably calculated with {@link #generateResistances(char[][])}; 1.0 blocks light, 0.0 allows it
643     * @param light will be overwritten! Should be initialized with the same size as {@code resistanceMap}
644     * @param rippleLooseness affects spread; between 1 and 6, inclusive; 1 is tightest, 2 is normal, and 6 is loosest
645     * @param x starting x position to look from
646     * @param y starting y position to look from
647     * @param radius the distance to extend from the starting x,y position
648     * @param radiusTechnique how to measure distance; typically {@link Radius#CIRCLE}.
649     * @param angle the angle to center the conical FOV on
650     * @param span the total span in degrees for the conical FOV to cover
651     * @return {@code light}, after writing the FOV map into it; 1.0 is fully lit and 0.0 is unseen
652     */
653    public static double[][] reuseRippleFOV(double[][] resistanceMap, double[][] light, int rippleLooseness, int x, int y, double radius, Radius radiusTechnique, double angle, double span) {
654        ArrayTools.fill(light, 0);
655        light[x][y] = Math.min(1.0, radius);//make the starting space full power unless radius is tiny
656        lightWorkspace.resizeAndEmpty(light.length, light[0].length);
657        angle = ((angle >= 360.0 || angle < 0.0)
658                ? MathExtras.remainder(angle, 360.0) : angle) * 0.002777777777777778;
659        span = span * 0.002777777777777778;
660        doRippleFOV(light, MathExtras.clamp(rippleLooseness, 1, 6), x, y, 1.0 / radius, radius, resistanceMap, lightWorkspace, radiusTechnique, angle, span);
661        return light;
662    }
663
664        /**
665         * Reuses the existing light 2D array and fills it with a straight-line bouncing path of light that reflects its way
666         * through the given resistanceMap from startX, startY until it uses up the given distance. The angle the path
667         * takes is given in degrees, and the angle used can change as obstacles are hit (reflecting backwards if it hits a
668         * corner pointing directly into or away from its path). This can be used something like an LOS method, but because
669         * the path can be traveled back over, an array or Queue becomes somewhat more complex, and the decreasing numbers
670         * for a straight line that stack may make more sense for how this could be used (especially with visual effects).
671         * This currently allows the path to pass through single-cell wall-like obstacles without changing direction, e.g.
672         * it passes through pillars, but will bounce if it hits a bigger wall.
673         * @param resistanceMap the grid of cells to calculate on; the kind made by {@link #generateResistances(char[][])}
674         * @param light the grid of cells to assign to; may have existing values, and 0.0 is used to mean "unlit"
675         * @param startX the horizontal component of the starting location
676         * @param startY the vertical component of the starting location
677         * @param distance the distance the light will extend to
678         * @param angle in degrees, the angle to start the path traveling in
679         * @return the given light parameter, after modifications
680         */
681    public static double[][] bouncingLine(double[][] resistanceMap, double[][] light, int startX, int startY, double distance, double angle)
682    {
683        double rad = Math.max(1, distance);
684        double decay = 1.0 / rad;
685        ArrayTools.fill(light, 0);
686        light[startX][startY] = 1;//make the starting space full power
687        angle = Math.toRadians((angle > 360.0 || angle < 0.0)
688                ? MathExtras.remainder(angle, 360.0) : angle);
689        float s = (float) NumberTools.sin(angle),
690                c = (float) NumberTools.cos(angle);
691        double deteriorate = 1.0;
692        int dx, dy, width = resistanceMap.length, height = resistanceMap[0].length;
693        for (int d = 1; d <= rad; ) {
694            dx = startX + Math.round(c * d);
695            if(dx < 0 || dx > width)
696                break;
697            dy = startY + Math.round(s * d);
698            if(dy < 0 || dy > height)
699                break;
700            deteriorate -= decay;
701            //check if it's within the lightable area and light if needed
702            if (deteriorate > 0.0) {
703                light[dx][dy] = Math.min(light[dx][dy] + deteriorate, 1.0);
704                if (resistanceMap[dx][dy] >= 1 && deteriorate > decay)
705                {
706                    startX = dx;
707                    startY = dy;
708                    d = 1;
709                    double flipX = resistanceMap[startX + Math.round(-c * d)][dy],
710                            flipY = resistanceMap[dx][startY + Math.round(-s * d)];
711                    if(flipX >= 1.0)
712                        s = -s;
713                    if(flipY >= 1.0)
714                        c = -c;
715                }
716                else ++d;
717
718            }
719            else break;
720        }
721
722        return light;
723    }
724    /**
725         * @param width
726         *            The width that {@link #light} should have.
727         * @param height
728         *            The height that {@link #light} should have.
729         */
730        private void initializeLightMap(int width, int height) {
731                if (light == null)
732                        light = new double[width][height];
733                else {
734                        if (light.length != width || light[0].length != height)
735                                /* Size changed */
736                                light = new double[width][height];
737                        else {
738                                /*
739                                 * Size did not change, we simply need to erase the previous
740                                 * result
741                                 */
742                                ArrayTools.fill(light, 0.0);
743                        }
744                }
745        }
746
747        /**
748         * @param width
749         *            The width that {@link #nearLight} should have.
750         * @param height
751         *            The height that {@link #nearLight} should have.
752         */
753        private void initializeNearLight(int width, int height) {
754                if (nearLight == null) {
755                    /* Can't do much with null */
756            nearLight = new GreasedRegion(width, height);
757        }
758                else {
759                        if (nearLight.width != width || nearLight.height != height) {
760                /* Size changed */
761                nearLight.resizeAndEmpty(width, height);
762            }
763                        else {
764                                /*
765                                 * Size did not change, we simply need to erase the previous
766                                 * result
767                                 */
768                                nearLight.clear();
769                        }
770                }
771        }
772
773        private static int rippleValue(int type) {
774                switch (type) {
775                case RIPPLE:
776                        return 2;
777                case RIPPLE_LOOSE:
778                        return 3;
779                case RIPPLE_TIGHT:
780                        return 1;
781                case RIPPLE_VERY_LOOSE:
782                        return 6;
783                default:
784                        System.err.println("Unrecognized ripple type: " + type + ". Defaulting to RIPPLE");
785                        return 2;
786                }
787        }
788
789    private static void doRippleFOV(double[][] lightMap, int ripple, int x, int y, double decay, double radius, double[][] map, GreasedRegion indirect, Radius radiusStrategy) {
790        dq.clear();
791        int width = lightMap.length;
792        int height = lightMap[0].length;
793        dq.offer(Coord.get(x, y));
794        while (!dq.isEmpty()) {
795            Coord p = dq.removeFirst();
796            if (lightMap[p.x][p.y] <= 0 || indirect.contains(p)) {
797                continue;//no light to spread
798            }
799
800            for (Direction dir : Direction.OUTWARDS) {
801                int x2 = p.x + dir.deltaX;
802                int y2 = p.y + dir.deltaY;
803                if (x2 < 0 || x2 >= width || y2 < 0 || y2 >= height //out of bounds
804                        || radiusStrategy.radius(x, y, x2, y2) >= radius + 1) {//+1 to cover starting tile
805                    continue;
806                }
807
808                double surroundingLight = nearRippleLight(x2, y2, ripple, x, y, decay, lightMap, map, indirect, radiusStrategy);
809                if (lightMap[x2][y2] < surroundingLight) {
810                    lightMap[x2][y2] = surroundingLight;
811                    if (map[x2][y2] < 1) {//make sure it's not a wall
812                        dq.offer(Coord.get(x2, y2));//redo neighbors since this one's light changed
813                    }
814                }
815            }
816        }
817    }
818
819
820
821    private static void doRippleFOV(double[][] lightMap, int ripple, int x, int y, double decay, double radius, double[][] map, GreasedRegion indirect, Radius radiusStrategy, double angle, double span) {
822            dq.clear();
823        int width = lightMap.length;
824        int height = lightMap[0].length;
825        dq.offer(Coord.get(x, y));
826        while (!dq.isEmpty()) {
827            Coord p = dq.removeFirst();
828            if (lightMap[p.x][p.y] <= 0 || indirect.contains(p)) {
829                continue;//no light to spread
830            }
831
832            for (Direction dir : ccw_full) {
833                int x2 = p.x + dir.deltaX;
834                int y2 = p.y + dir.deltaY;
835                if (x2 < 0 || x2 >= width || y2 < 0 || y2 >= height //out of bounds
836                        || radiusStrategy.radius(x, y, x2, y2) >= radius + 1) {//+1 to cover starting tile
837                    continue;
838                }
839                double newAngle = NumberTools.atan2_(y2 - y, x2 - x) - angle;
840                newAngle -= Noise.fastFloor(newAngle);
841                if (newAngle > span * 0.5f && newAngle < 1.0f - span * 0.5f)
842                    continue;
843
844                double surroundingLight = nearRippleLight(x2, y2, ripple, x, y, decay, lightMap, map, indirect, radiusStrategy );
845                if (lightMap[x2][y2] < surroundingLight) {
846                    lightMap[x2][y2] = surroundingLight;
847                    if (map[x2][y2] < 1) {//make sure it's not a wall
848                        dq.offer(Coord.get(x2, y2));//redo neighbors since this one's light changed
849                    }
850                }
851            }
852        }
853    }
854
855    private static double nearRippleLight(int x, int y, int rippleNeighbors, int startx, int starty, double decay, double[][] lightMap, double[][] map, GreasedRegion indirect, Radius radiusStrategy) {
856        if (x == startx && y == starty) {
857            return 1;
858        }
859        int width = lightMap.length;
860        int height = lightMap[0].length;
861        List<Coord> neighbors = new ArrayList<>();
862        double tmpDistance = 0, testDistance;
863        Coord c;
864        for (Direction di : Direction.OUTWARDS) {
865            int x2 = x + di.deltaX;
866            int y2 = y + di.deltaY;
867            if (x2 >= 0 && x2 < width && y2 >= 0 && y2 < height) {
868                tmpDistance = radiusStrategy.radius(startx, starty, x2, y2);
869                int idx = 0;
870                for(int i = 0; i < neighbors.size() && i <= rippleNeighbors; i++)
871                {
872                    c = neighbors.get(i);
873                    testDistance = radiusStrategy.radius(startx, starty, c.x, c.y);
874                    if(tmpDistance < testDistance) {
875                        break;
876                    }
877                    idx++;
878                }
879                neighbors.add(idx, Coord.get(x2, y2));
880            }
881        }
882
883        if (neighbors.isEmpty()) {
884            return 0;
885        }
886        neighbors = neighbors.subList(0, Math.min(neighbors.size(), rippleNeighbors));
887/*
888        while (neighbors.size() > rippleNeighbors) {
889            Coord p = neighbors.remove(0);
890            double dist = radiusStrategy.radius(startx, starty, p.x, p.y);
891            double dist2 = 0;
892            for (Coord p2 : neighbors) {
893                dist2 = Math.max(dist2, radiusStrategy.radius(startx, starty, p2.x, p2.y));
894            }
895            if (dist < dist2) {//not the largest, put it back
896                neighbors.add(p);
897            }
898        }
899*/
900        double light = 0;
901        int lit = 0, indirects = 0;
902        for (Coord p : neighbors) {
903            if (lightMap[p.x][p.y] > 0) {
904                lit++;
905                if (indirect.contains(p)) {
906                    indirects++;
907                }
908                double dist = radiusStrategy.radius(x, y, p.x, p.y);
909                light = Math.max(light, lightMap[p.x][p.y] - dist * decay - map[p.x][p.y]);
910            }
911        }
912
913        if (map[x][y] >= 1 || indirects >= lit) {
914            indirect.insert(x, y);
915        }
916        return light;
917    }
918
919    private static void shadowCast(int xx, int xy, int yx, int yy,
920                                   double radius, int startx, int starty, double decay, double[][] lightMap,
921                                   double[][] map, Radius radiusStrategy) {
922            shadowCast(1, 1.0, 0.0, xx, xy, yx, yy, radius, startx, starty, decay, lightMap, map, radiusStrategy,
923                0, 0, lightMap.length, lightMap[0].length);
924    }
925
926    private static void shadowCastBinary(int row, double start, double end, int xx, int xy, int yx, int yy,
927                                         double radius, int startx, int starty, double decay, double[][] lightMap,
928                                         double[][] map, Radius radiusStrategy,
929                                         int minX, int minY, int maxX, int maxY) {
930        double newStart = 0;
931        if (start < end) {
932            return;
933        }
934
935        boolean blocked = false;
936        for (int distance = row; distance <= radius && distance < maxX - minX + maxY - minY && !blocked; distance++) {
937            int deltaY = -distance;
938            for (int deltaX = -distance; deltaX <= 0; deltaX++) {
939                int currentX = startx + deltaX * xx + deltaY * xy;
940                int currentY = starty + deltaX * yx + deltaY * yy;
941                double leftSlope = (deltaX - 0.5f) / (deltaY + 0.5f);
942                double rightSlope = (deltaX + 0.5f) / (deltaY - 0.5f);
943
944                if (!(currentX >= minX && currentY >= minY && currentX < maxX && currentY < maxY) || start < rightSlope) {
945                    continue;
946                } else if (end > leftSlope) {
947                    break;
948                }
949
950                lightMap[currentX][currentY] = 1.0;
951
952                if (blocked) { //previous cell was a blocking one
953                    if (map[currentX][currentY] >= 1) {//hit a wall
954                        newStart = rightSlope;
955                    } else {
956                        blocked = false;
957                        start = newStart;
958                    }
959                } else {
960                    if (map[currentX][currentY] >= 1 && distance < radius) {//hit a wall within sight line
961                        blocked = true;
962                        shadowCastBinary(distance + 1, start, leftSlope, xx, xy, yx, yy, radius, startx, starty, decay,
963                                lightMap, map, radiusStrategy, minX, minY, maxX, maxY);
964                        newStart = rightSlope;
965                    }
966                }
967            }
968        }
969    }
970
971    private static boolean shadowCastCheck(int row, double start, double end, int xx, int xy, int yx, int yy,
972                                         double radius, int startx, int starty, double decay, double[][] lightMap,
973                                         double[][] map, Radius radiusStrategy,
974                                         int minX, int minY, int maxX, int maxY, int targetX, int targetY) {
975        double newStart = 0;
976        if (start < end) {
977            return false;
978        }
979
980        boolean blocked = false;
981        for (int distance = row; distance <= radius && distance < maxX - minX + maxY - minY && !blocked; distance++) {
982            int deltaY = -distance;
983            for (int deltaX = -distance; deltaX <= 0; deltaX++) {
984                int currentX = startx + deltaX * xx + deltaY * xy;
985                int currentY = starty + deltaX * yx + deltaY * yy;
986                double leftSlope = (deltaX - 0.5f) / (deltaY + 0.5f);
987                double rightSlope = (deltaX + 0.5f) / (deltaY - 0.5f);
988
989                if (!(currentX >= minX && currentY >= minY && currentX < maxX && currentY < maxY) || start < rightSlope) {
990                    continue;
991                } else if (end > leftSlope) {
992                    break;
993                }
994
995                if(currentX == targetX && currentY == targetY) return true;
996
997                if (blocked) { //previous cell was a blocking one
998                    if (map[currentX][currentY] >= 1.0) {//hit a wall
999                        newStart = rightSlope;
1000                    } else {
1001                        blocked = false;
1002                        start = newStart;
1003                    }
1004                } else {
1005                    if (map[currentX][currentY] >= 1.0 && distance < radius) {//hit a wall within sight line
1006                        blocked = true;
1007                        if(shadowCastCheck(distance + 1, start, leftSlope, xx, xy, yx, yy, radius, startx, starty, decay,
1008                                lightMap, map, radiusStrategy, minX, minY, maxX, maxY, targetX, targetY))
1009                            return true;
1010                        newStart = rightSlope;
1011                    }
1012                }
1013            }
1014        }
1015        return false;
1016    }
1017
1018    private static void shadowCast(int row, double start, double end, int xx, int xy, int yx, int yy,
1019                                   double radius, int startx, int starty, double decay, double[][] lightMap,
1020                                   double[][] map, Radius radiusStrategy,
1021                                   int minX, int minY, int maxX, int maxY) {
1022        double newStart = 0;
1023        if (start < end) {
1024            return;
1025        }
1026
1027        boolean blocked = false;
1028        for (int distance = row; distance <= radius && distance < maxX - minX + maxY - minY && !blocked; distance++) {
1029            int deltaY = -distance;
1030            for (int deltaX = -distance; deltaX <= 0; deltaX++) {
1031                int currentX = startx + deltaX * xx + deltaY * xy;
1032                int currentY = starty + deltaX * yx + deltaY * yy;
1033                double leftSlope = (deltaX - 0.5f) / (deltaY + 0.5f);
1034                double rightSlope = (deltaX + 0.5f) / (deltaY - 0.5f);
1035
1036                if (!(currentX >= minX && currentY >= minY && currentX < maxX && currentY < maxY) || start < rightSlope) {
1037                    continue;
1038                } else if (end > leftSlope) {
1039                    break;
1040                }
1041                double deltaRadius = radiusStrategy.radius(deltaX, deltaY);
1042                //check if it's within the lightable area and light if needed
1043                if (deltaRadius <= radius) {
1044                    lightMap[currentX][currentY] = 1.0 - decay * deltaRadius; 
1045                }
1046
1047                if (blocked) { //previous cell was a blocking one
1048                    if (map[currentX][currentY] >= 1) {//hit a wall
1049                        newStart = rightSlope;
1050                    } else {
1051                        blocked = false;
1052                        start = newStart;
1053                    }
1054                } else {
1055                    if (map[currentX][currentY] >= 1 && distance < radius) {//hit a wall within sight line
1056                        blocked = true;
1057                        shadowCast(distance + 1, start, leftSlope, xx, xy, yx, yy, radius, startx, starty, decay,
1058                                lightMap, map, radiusStrategy, minX, minY, maxX, maxY);
1059                        newStart = rightSlope;
1060                    }
1061                }
1062            }
1063        }
1064    }
1065    private static double[][] shadowCastLimited(int row, double start, double end, int xx, int xy, int yx, int yy,
1066                                                double radius, int startx, int starty, double decay, double[][] lightMap,
1067                                                double[][] map, Radius radiusStrategy, double angle, double span) {
1068        double newStart = 0;
1069        if (start < end) {
1070            return lightMap;
1071        }
1072        int width = lightMap.length;
1073        int height = lightMap[0].length;
1074
1075        boolean blocked = false;
1076        for (int distance = row; distance <= radius && distance < width + height && !blocked; distance++) {
1077            int deltaY = -distance;
1078            for (int deltaX = -distance; deltaX <= 0; deltaX++) {
1079                int currentX = startx + deltaX * xx + deltaY * xy;
1080                int currentY = starty + deltaX * yx + deltaY * yy;
1081                double leftSlope = (deltaX - 0.5f) / (deltaY + 0.5f);
1082                double rightSlope = (deltaX + 0.5f) / (deltaY - 0.5f);
1083
1084                if (!(currentX >= 0 && currentY >= 0 && currentX < width && currentY < height) || start < rightSlope) {
1085                    continue;
1086                } else if (end > leftSlope) {
1087                    break;
1088                }
1089                double deltaRadius = radiusStrategy.radius(deltaX, deltaY),
1090                        at2 = Math.abs(angle - NumberTools.atan2_(currentY - starty, currentX - startx));// + 1.0) % 1.0;
1091                //check if it's within the lightable area and light if needed
1092                if (deltaRadius <= radius
1093                        && (at2 <= span * 0.5
1094                        || at2 >= 1.0 - span * 0.5)) {
1095                    double bright = 1 - decay * deltaRadius;
1096                    lightMap[currentX][currentY] = bright;
1097                }
1098
1099                if (blocked) { //previous cell was a blocking one
1100                    if (map[currentX][currentY] >= 1) {//hit a wall
1101                        newStart = rightSlope;
1102                    } else {
1103                        blocked = false;
1104                        start = newStart;
1105                    }
1106                } else {
1107                    if (map[currentX][currentY] >= 1 && distance < radius) {//hit a wall within sight line
1108                        blocked = true;
1109                        lightMap = shadowCastLimited(distance + 1, start, leftSlope, xx, xy, yx, yy, radius, startx, starty, decay, lightMap, map, radiusStrategy, angle, span);
1110                        newStart = rightSlope;
1111                    }
1112                }
1113            }
1114        }
1115        return lightMap;
1116    }
1117
1118    private static final double[] directionRanges = new double[8];
1119    /**
1120     * Calculates the Field Of View for the provided map from the given x, y
1121     * coordinates, lighting with the view "pointed at" the given {@code angle} in degrees,
1122     * extending to different ranges based on the direction the light is traveling.
1123     * The direction ranges are {@code forward}, {@code sideForward}, {@code side},
1124     * {@code sideBack}, and {@code back}; all are multiplied by {@code radius}.
1125     * Assigns to, and returns, a light map where the values represent a percentage of fully
1126     * lit. The values in light are cleared before this is run, because prior state can make
1127     * this give incorrect results. You can use {@link #addFOVsInto(double[][], double[][]...)}
1128     * if you want to mix FOV results, which works as an alternative to using the prior light state.
1129     * <br>
1130     * The starting point for the calculation is considered to be at the center
1131     * of the origin cell. Radius determinations are determined by the provided
1132     * RadiusStrategy. If all direction ranges are the same, this acts like
1133     * {@link #reuseFOV(double[][], double[][], int, int, double, Radius)}; otherwise
1134     * may produce conical shapes (potentially more than one, or overlapping ones).
1135     *
1136     * @param resistanceMap the grid of cells to calculate on; the kind made by {@link #generateResistances(char[][])}
1137     * @param light the grid of cells to assign to; may have existing values, and 0.0 is used to mean "unlit"
1138     * @param startX the horizontal component of the starting location
1139     * @param startY the vertical component of the starting location
1140     * @param radius the distance the light will extend to (roughly); direction ranges will be multiplied by this
1141     * @param radiusTechnique provides a means to shape the FOV by changing distance calculation (circle, square, etc.)
1142     * @param angle the angle in degrees that will be the center of the FOV cone, 0 points right
1143     * @param forward the range to extend when the light is within 22.5 degrees of angle; will be interpolated with sideForward
1144     * @param sideForward the range to extend when the light is between 22.5 and 67.5 degrees of angle; will be interpolated with forward or side
1145     * @param side the range to extend when the light is between 67.5 and 112.5 degrees of angle; will be interpolated with sideForward or sideBack
1146     * @param sideBack the range to extend when the light is between 112.5 and 157.5 degrees of angle; will be interpolated with side or back
1147     * @param back the range to extend when the light is more than 157.5 degrees away from angle; will be interpolated with sideBack
1148     * @return the computed light grid (the same as {@code light})
1149     */
1150    public static double[][] reuseFOV(double[][] resistanceMap, double[][] light, int startX, int startY,
1151                                      double radius, Radius radiusTechnique, double angle,
1152                                      double forward, double sideForward, double side, double sideBack, double back) {
1153        directionRanges[0] = forward * radius;
1154        directionRanges[7] = directionRanges[1] = sideForward * radius;
1155        directionRanges[6] = directionRanges[2] = side * radius;
1156        directionRanges[5] = directionRanges[3] = sideBack * radius;
1157        directionRanges[4] = back * radius;
1158
1159        radius = Math.max(1, radius);
1160        ArrayTools.fill(light, 0);
1161        light[startX][startY] = 1;//make the starting space full power
1162        angle = ((angle >= 360.0 || angle < 0.0)
1163                ? MathExtras.remainder(angle, 360.0) : angle) * 0.002777777777777778;
1164
1165
1166        light = shadowCastPersonalized(1, 1.0, 0.0, 0, 1, 1, 0,   radius, startX, startY, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique, angle, directionRanges);
1167        light = shadowCastPersonalized(1, 1.0, 0.0, 1, 0, 0, 1,   radius, startX, startY, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique, angle, directionRanges);
1168        light = shadowCastPersonalized(1, 1.0, 0.0, 0, -1, 1, 0,  radius, startX, startY, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique, angle, directionRanges);
1169        light = shadowCastPersonalized(1, 1.0, 0.0, -1, 0, 0, 1,  radius, startX, startY, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique, angle, directionRanges);
1170        light = shadowCastPersonalized(1, 1.0, 0.0, 0, -1, -1, 0, radius, startX, startY, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique, angle, directionRanges);
1171        light = shadowCastPersonalized(1, 1.0, 0.0, -1, 0, 0, -1, radius, startX, startY, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique, angle, directionRanges);
1172        light = shadowCastPersonalized(1, 1.0, 0.0, 0, 1, -1, 0,  radius, startX, startY, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique, angle, directionRanges);
1173        light = shadowCastPersonalized(1, 1.0, 0.0, 1, 0, 0, -1,  radius, startX, startY, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique, angle, directionRanges);
1174        return light;
1175    }
1176
1177    private static double[][] shadowCastPersonalized(int row, double start, double end, int xx, int xy, int yx, int yy,
1178                                                     double radius, int startx, int starty, double[][] lightMap,
1179                                                     double[][] map, Radius radiusStrategy, double angle, final double[] directionRanges) {
1180        double newStart = 0;
1181        if (start < end) {
1182            return lightMap;
1183        }
1184        int width = lightMap.length;
1185        int height = lightMap[0].length;
1186
1187        boolean blocked = false;
1188        for (int distance = row; distance <= radius && distance < width + height && !blocked; distance++) {
1189            int deltaY = -distance;
1190            for (int deltaX = -distance; deltaX <= 0; deltaX++) {
1191                int currentX = startx + deltaX * xx + deltaY * xy;
1192                int currentY = starty + deltaX * yx + deltaY * yy;
1193                double leftSlope = (deltaX - 0.5f) / (deltaY + 0.5f);
1194                double rightSlope = (deltaX + 0.5f) / (deltaY - 0.5f);
1195
1196                if (!(currentX >= 0 && currentY >= 0 && currentX < width && currentY < height) || start < rightSlope) {
1197                    continue;
1198                } else if (end > leftSlope) {
1199                    break;
1200                }
1201                double at2 = Math.abs(angle - NumberTools.atan2_(currentY - starty, currentX - startx)) * 8.0,
1202                        deltaRadius = radiusStrategy.radius(deltaX, deltaY);
1203                int ia = (int)(at2), low = ia & 7, high = ia + 1 & 7;
1204                double a = at2 - ia, adjRadius = (1.0 - a) * directionRanges[low] + a * directionRanges[high];
1205                //check if it's within the lightable area and light if needed
1206                if (deltaRadius <= adjRadius) {
1207                    lightMap[currentX][currentY] = 1.0 - (deltaRadius / (adjRadius + 1.0)); // how bright the tile is
1208                }
1209
1210                if (blocked) { //previous cell was a blocking one
1211                    if (map[currentX][currentY] >= 1) {//hit a wall
1212                        newStart = rightSlope;
1213                    } else {
1214                        blocked = false;
1215                        start = newStart;
1216                    }
1217                } else {
1218                    if (map[currentX][currentY] >= 1 && distance < adjRadius) {//hit a wall within sight line
1219                        blocked = true;
1220                        lightMap = shadowCastPersonalized(distance + 1, start, leftSlope, xx, xy, yx, yy, radius, startx, starty, lightMap, map, radiusStrategy, angle, directionRanges);
1221                        newStart = rightSlope;
1222                    }
1223                }
1224            }
1225        }
1226        return lightMap;
1227    }
1228
1229    /**
1230     * Adds an FOV map to another in the simplest way possible; does not check line-of-sight between FOV maps.
1231     * Clamps the highest value for any single position at 1.0. Modifies the basis parameter in-place and makes no
1232     * allocations; this is different from {@link #addFOVs(double[][][])}, which creates a new 2D array.
1233     * @param basis a 2D double array, which can be empty or returned by calculateFOV() or reuseFOV(); modified!
1234     * @param addend another 2D double array that will be added into basis; this one will not be modified
1235     * @return the sum of the 2D double arrays passed, using the dimensions of basis if they don't match
1236     */
1237    public static double[][] addFOVsInto(double[][] basis, double[][] addend)
1238    {
1239        for (int x = 0; x < basis.length && x < addend.length; x++) {
1240                for (int y = 0; y < basis[x].length && y < addend[x].length; y++) {
1241                    basis[x][y] = Math.min(1.0, basis[x][y] + addend[x][y]);
1242                }
1243            }
1244        return basis;
1245    }
1246    /**
1247     * Adds multiple FOV maps together in the simplest way possible; does not check line-of-sight between FOV maps.
1248     * Clamps the highest value for any single position at 1.0. Allocates a new 2D double array and returns it.
1249     * @param maps an array or vararg of 2D double arrays, each usually returned by calculateFOV()
1250     * @return the sum of all the 2D double arrays passed, using the dimensions of the first if they don't all match
1251     */
1252    public static double[][] addFOVs(double[][]... maps)
1253    {
1254        if(maps == null || maps.length == 0)
1255            return new double[0][0];
1256        double[][] map = ArrayTools.copy(maps[0]);
1257        for(int i = 1; i < maps.length; i++)
1258        {
1259            for (int x = 0; x < map.length && x < maps[i].length; x++) {
1260                for (int y = 0; y < map[x].length && y < maps[i][x].length; y++) {
1261                    map[x][y] += maps[i][x][y];
1262                }
1263            }
1264        }
1265        for (int x = 0; x < map.length; x++) {
1266            for (int y = 0; y < map[x].length; y++) {
1267                if(map[x][y] > 1.0) map[x][y] = 1.0;
1268            }
1269        }
1270        return map;
1271    }
1272    /**
1273     * Adds multiple FOV maps to basis cell-by-cell, modifying basis; does not check line-of-sight between FOV maps.
1274     * Clamps the highest value for any single position at 1.0. Returns basis without allocating new objects.
1275     * @param basis a 2D double array that will be modified by adding values in maps to it and clamping to 1.0 or less 
1276     * @param maps an array or vararg of 2D double arrays, each usually returned by calculateFOV()
1277     * @return basis, with all elements in all of maps added to the corresponding cells and clamped
1278     */
1279    public static double[][] addFOVsInto(double[][] basis, double[][]... maps) {
1280        if (maps == null || maps.length == 0)
1281            return basis;
1282        for (int i = 1; i < maps.length; i++) {
1283            for (int x = 0; x < basis.length && x < maps[i].length; x++) {
1284                for (int y = 0; y < basis[x].length && y < maps[i][x].length; y++) {
1285                    basis[x][y] += maps[i][x][y];
1286                }
1287            }
1288        }
1289        for (int x = 0; x < basis.length; x++) {
1290            for (int y = 0; y < basis[x].length; y++) {
1291                if (basis[x][y] > 1.0) basis[x][y] = 1.0;
1292            }
1293        }
1294        return basis;
1295    }
1296
1297    /**
1298     * Adds multiple FOV maps together in the simplest way possible; does not check line-of-sight between FOV maps.
1299     * Clamps the highest value for any single position at 1.0. Allocates a new 2D double array and returns it.
1300     * @param maps an Iterable of 2D double arrays (most collections implement Iterable),
1301     *             each usually returned by calculateFOV()
1302     * @return the sum of all the 2D double arrays passed, using the dimensions of the first if they don't all match
1303     */
1304    public static double[][] addFOVs(Iterable<double[][]> maps)
1305    {
1306        if(maps == null)
1307            return new double[0][0];
1308        Iterator<double[][]> it = maps.iterator();
1309        if(!it.hasNext())
1310            return new double[0][0];
1311        double[][] map = ArrayTools.copy(it.next()), t;
1312        while (it.hasNext())
1313        {
1314            t = it.next();
1315            for (int x = 0; x < map.length && x < t.length; x++) {
1316                for (int y = 0; y < map[x].length && y < t[x].length; y++) {
1317                    map[x][y] += t[x][y];
1318                }
1319            }
1320        }
1321        for (int x = 0; x < map.length; x++) {
1322            for (int y = 0; y < map[x].length; y++) {
1323                if(map[x][y] > 1.0) map[x][y] = 1.0;
1324            }
1325        }
1326        return map;
1327    }
1328
1329    /**
1330     * Adds together multiple FOV maps, but only adds to a position if it is visible in the given LOS map. Useful if
1331     * you want distant lighting to be visible only if the player has line-of-sight to a lit cell. Typically the LOS map
1332     * is calculated by {@link #reuseLOS(double[][], double[][], int, int)}, using the same resistance map used to
1333     * calculate the FOV maps. Clamps the highest value for any single position at 1.0.
1334     * @param losMap an LOS map such as one generated by {@link #reuseLOS(double[][], double[][], int, int)}
1335     * @param maps an array or vararg of 2D double arrays, each usually returned by calculateFOV()
1336     * @return the sum of all the 2D double arrays in maps where a cell was visible in losMap
1337     */
